channel.title: Projects on Floyd Skakane
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Floyd Skakane

item.title: DStv Log Table Downloader
item.description: In this project, the intention was to create a simple webscraping app for downloading customizable DStv premiership log table in real time. This app was created on Streamlit which is an open-source python library for creating and sharing web apps for data science and machine learning projects (Source: Hackernoon). The required libraries used are base64, pandas and streamlit. The app scrapes log table data from the EuroSport website that are customizable by the league season and number of teams selected.

item.title: Movie Recommender Engine
item.description: Unsupervised Learning Project Probably one of the most crucial business functions of any streaming platforms is the ability to make recommendations that each specific user is highly likely to engage with. This tends to increase subscriber base and decrease churn rate. This project aims to utilize various modelling techniques to recommend movies to users with high accuracy. Since the data is unstructured i.e. the data does not have any labels, the project is classified as an unsupervised learning problem.

item.title: Climate Change Tweet Analysis
item.description: Classification Project With ‘climate change’ being the buzz words of the current era, understanding attitudes the general public has with regards to climate change is of crucial importance and we use tweets regarding climate change to classify random tweets into 1 of 4 categories: news, neutral, pro and anti climate change. Overview of sentiment classes and keywords In this project we participated as a team of 5 members and my role was to perform data analysis and build and deploy a streamlit app.

item.title: Language Identification
item.description: Classification Project South African languages distribution overview The goal of this project/challenge is to improve the accuracy of classifying random text into 1 of 11 of South African official languages. In this project I used natural language processing (NLP) techniques to clean-up text data that is used as an input in training our models and making predictions. The performance of the models used is shown below. Model performance Once finished, a kaggle submission was made that ranks model performance by the Mean F1-Score.

item.title: Load Shortfall Predictor
item.description: Regression Project As the world is generally moving greener, the question of moving from traditional fossil fuels to renewable resources in electricity generation is no longer an if but when question. In this project we aimed to predict the amount of electricity load shortfall that could be experienced when shifting from fossil fuels to renewable resources for the country of Spain. We were a team of 5 members and I performed overall oversight of the project and mainly ensured successful deployment of the project to AWS EC2.

item.title: Dashboards in Power BI
item.description: Although reiterative, the life cycle of a data science project ultimately ends in providing insight. Having to produce interactive platforms that can be widely used by a wide range of users from the least to the most technical is crucial in the data science framework. Below are interactive platforms I created on Power BI: I. Eskom Infrastructure, Twitter, Capacity and Efficiency Dashboards Eskom infrastructure dashboard Eskom capacity and efficiency dashboard Eskom twitter dashboard II.
